website_summaries.verdict: A basic metal kickstand that's easy to install and stays in place while you ride.
pros: Sturdy, center-mount kickstand with rubber boot included
Installation takes a matter of minutes
Won't loosen or slide down on you over time
cons: This kickstand is not adjustable, so it's not for bikes over 22 inches

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for my road bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice kickstand. No plastic, basic, and good looking. Read another review where the guy ran into a problem with the cable going through the triangle behind the bottom bracket, so he just notched it out. Figured thats what i would do! However, on my roadie the space was too small unfortunately. I filed it down to the point of almost going into the hole in the mounting bracket, and it was still a no go (bolt is just too big). So, don't want to downgrade the product-just didn't work for my application (but on normal cruiser/hybrid type bike you will be good to go)
customer_reviews.author: per.line

customer_reviews.title: ok product, but didn't suit my needs
customer_reviews.text: This is a cut-to-suit model that takes some trial & error to install. Once it's cut, it's cut. If too short, you can't get the length back. Had to cut three times to get the prefect length for the wife's bike. I worked fine, but after we added a basket to the handle bars, it changed the balance of the bike and was prone to falling over if lightly bumped. I ended up changing this kickstand out for an adjustable model with a larger foot and it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: sydneydanny

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with a stand from Greenfield!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, works great, simple to install, reasonably priced... -AND- 'Made in the USA!?' This is a great kickstand... installation took less than a minute and it's locked on tight; there's no play or wobble once you screw it down. Deploys easily, then bumps back up to the frame with minimal effort and stays in place again until you move it. The leg required no cutting to fit my adult Diamondback XE, and the black fits the color scheme nicely. NOTE: Mine came with the rubber foot INCLUDED... and judging by several of the other reviews, I'm not alone. (Though even if it didn't, I probably wouldn't order one separately as I don't think it's necessary.)
customer_reviews.author: Randy Watson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Our Bikes
customer_reviews.text: I got this model for three bikes, two Marin Larkspurs from 2004-2007 time frame and a Schwinn Kids Koen 16 inch. Get a hacksaw, measure for size, note your mark, and cut. The pre-marked increments/cut lines are a great help. Super easy. If in doubt, cut bigger than you need then adjust. File the cut end to deburr if you want. I didn't have to cut at all for the Marins; they are sized perfectly at 285. There doesn't appear to be any issue with the plate interfering with the cable on the Marins. For the Koen I cut to 205 mm. I probably could have cut to 200 for more lean but it works as is so no need.
customer_reviews.author: Maestro

customer_reviews.title: Quality Kickstand
customer_reviews.text: My 1970 Raleigh Gran Prix had a kickstand originally. But, in my youth and lighter is faster era I removed it, never to find again. The kickstand made by Greenfield can be purchased in differing lengths. Also, it only takes a vice and a hacksaw to cut to desired length to create the stable lean angle for your bike. Fitment to frame was perfect and the kickstand retracts quickly to nestle up secure against the rear wheel frame member. Price point was very good. Saved me the hourly labor and higher price for a "Raleigh" part which is fine with me.
customer_reviews.author: A. B. COLE

customer_reviews.title: Only for 22” bikes unless you want to saw metal
customer_reviews.text: Only for 22” bikes unless you want to saw them file down the metal kickstand with a hack saw- that’s how it adjusts to fit smaller bikes. We have on a 20” bike and it will be okay I think (it’s not angled quite enough), but anything smaller and you’d have to saw & file down the metal. It’s worth the $6 to buy one that is truly adjustable in and of itself.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Sechrest

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived and we realized that the package was previously opened and a nut was missing. We made 2 trips to the local home improvement store to buy the proper nut, thinking it would be easier than returning the item and waiting for a replacement. After 2 nuts did not fit the bolt, we determined the bolt was stripped. At this point, I looked at the instructions on the package and saw that also a rubber cover was not included either. We were 1 day past the warranty and realized we are stuck with this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: comes unscrewed
customer_reviews.text: This is really sturdy and easy to install. It will probably work on most bikes. However, it doesn't come with a bolt or a washer or anything and it works loose as you ride your bike. I spent extra on this kick stand so it is pretty annoying. The sellers should include a bolt and washer to prevent this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Good quality kickstand
customer_reviews.text: I like this kickstand because it has a nice snap-back motion. Nice and sturdy. I didn't get the one with the rubber foot, but he probably would just lay it down in the grass anyway. This same model is on both of my son's bmx bikes and it works well. One of them was on a hand-me-down and is probably 20+ years old. Had to shorten the new one about a half inch. A dull old hacksaw blade made the cut no problem, cleaned it up with a file to make sure no burrs to scratch the kid's ankles.
customer_reviews.author: BillyDoc

customer_reviews.title: Great kick stand - Look no further.  This is the one you want.
customer_reviews.text: Great kick stand. Light weight aluminum. Very well made with a positive "up" & "down" position and great mounting hardware. You will need to cut it to length which I did with a angle grinder with a cutoff blade but can easily be done with a hack saw. I tool off only 1/4" at a time to get mine just to the right height. It took three cuts but I did not want to take off too much since this is a "once and done" setup as opposed to those awful "adjustable" kick stands. I highly recommend this one. Took me a while to find this exact stand on Amazon. This is the one you want.
customer_reviews.author: LS Review

customer_reviews.title: Great stand, after some minor fitting for a smaller bike
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my daughters 18" bike. The kickstand is too long for an 18" kids bike, BUT an angle grinder made quick work of it. The stand is solid aluminum, so cutting the stand shorter is perfectly fine. I mounted the stand first, then kept cutting off ~1/2" sections and testing it. After a few cuts it was perfect. (Caution, it gets hot!) I sanded it smooth, then shoved the rubber cover over the end. It works great. The stand rubs ever so slightly on the back wheel, but it's not really a problem. I may end up bending the stand out a little.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Ash

customer_reviews.title: Great kickstand
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my 5 year old 16 inch bike. After training wheels came off, it always was on the ground. I grew up never having kickstands on my bikes, do not have one on my current bike. But for my five year old he would just drop his bike on the ground and handle bars get misaligned, so I was like no more. Fits on the back side next to the back wheel. Has little indentation on it so it fits into the slot of the frame, where back wheel fit. I buy it again and actually like it better than the kickstand behind the pedals
customer_reviews.author: Pleasant1911

customer_reviews.title: Stand me up, will ya?!?!
customer_reviews.text: Beware, that the factory package is so cheap that it's likely that half the hardware is lost in a warehouse somewhere. The blister pack on first one I received was mostly open due to cheap, failing adhesive. This resulted in a few missing parts. However, a quick chat with Amazon and a new one was on the way. Well, second verse - same as the first, with failed manufacturer packaging. This time I was lucky enough to receive all the hardware I needed from the first go 'round, and I was able to make one complete kit out of the two shipments.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hall

customer_reviews.title: 30 years later, still same quality
customer_reviews.text: These are great kickstands. Well built and sturdy. You can cut them down with a hacksaw if you need it to be shorter, so it works for nearly all bikes. I used this mounted to the deck of a cargo trailer. It needed to be much shorter, which prompted me to buy this style. I remember when I was a kid, my dad would install that new kickstand on my new bike and then trim it down just like I did today. Took me back... Good stuff. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JustMike

customer_reviews.title: It’s huuuuuuuuuggggeeeee!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a 16” kids bike. And let’s just say this kick stand is enormous. You will definitely have to cut it down for it to work on probably anything other than the Jolly Green Giants bike. But after cutting it down with my angle grinder it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i needed.
customer_reviews.text: This fits my Tommaso La Forma (medium frame) perfectly...no hacksaw needed! I bought the retail packaged version, which included 2 bolts, a lock washer, the stand, the top clamp, and the rubber foot. It came in a blister pack, but the cardboard on the side extended past the plastic blister, making it very easy to open. Assembly was a snap, and it sure seems sturdy enough. It "locks" into the up and down positions in a reassuring way. It feels solid, looks nice, and the price is great, too.
customer_reviews.author: kell

customer_reviews.title: Great kickstand at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: My mountain bike did not come with a kick stand; now that I am using it more for commuting, I wanted to add one. This kick stand is easy to install and feels secure. I did not have to cut the stand to fit my bike. One thing I added was a rubber foot at the end to prevent it from slipping and digging into grass. I'm not sure why the manufacturer didn't include one. Overall, I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Distant Planet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Choice
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed for an older mountain bike. The descriptions and reviews of other kickstands made me wonder if they would work on our bike, but we mounted this one in the space just behind the crank using the upper plate and longer bolt with integral teeth on the bolt shoulder to keep it snug. A shorter bolt is included, probably for those bikes with an integral mounting plate. And it even included a rubber foot!.
customer_reviews.author: marketsons

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy but loosened up after first ride.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two and installed on two bikes make sure you wrench them on tight. I had one come loose after one ride and used the kickstand only a few times. I will put some lock tight on it now and should be good. We used them in two large mountain bikes and were very sturdy until one loosened up. And you will need a metric wrench 14mm to tighten. Still a lot nicer than plastic ones. If your bike is short you will need to cut the metal.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Silva

customer_reviews.title: Strike a blow against the anti-kickstand cabal!
customer_reviews.text: I installed one of these babies on my Trek mountain bike that I use as a commuter. It's always stuck in my craw a bit that decent (non-Walmart-level) bikes omit the kickstand. It strikes me as some snooty goofball bike subculture thing, as if the 12 ounces you save by not having one is going to make your trip to the farmer's market so much more efficient that it negates the constant annoyance of having your kickstand-less bike fall over from where it's propped whenever there's a gentle breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, lightweight , easy to install and made in USA.
customer_reviews.text: I have lived without a kickstand on my Cannodale Road Warrior for 10 years, but decided on a whim to buy one the other day. This Greenfield stand is aluminum, (just like the frame on my bike) and looks like it was made for the bike. I did have to cut off about 2 inches to get the bike to lean over properly, but was easy with a manual hacksaw. I would guess that most bikes will require the leg to be shortened as my bike has 28" wheels. A big plus is that Greenfield makes their stands in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Pot Metal. Cheap junk
customer_reviews.text: Mine broke off 3" from the bottom from a simple bike drop. The grain and non-magnetic properties indicate cheap metals. Cast aluminum at best, but probably an even cheaper allow. There is no offset part at the bottom and no rubber foot. You cannot heat and bend because it is cast. the tip sinks into the ground. You will need a hacksaw (or sawzall) to cut it to proper length.
customer_reviews.author: The Electron Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Super Sturdy Kick Stand, Installed very easily on a 24inch Mountain Bike.
customer_reviews.text: We recently bought a 24 inch mountain bike that did not come with a kick stand, upon research i found that Greenfield Kick Stands are the best and ordered one, This one arrived quickly and was very easy to install, is very strong and is able to support the weight of the bicycle just fine when mounted. should serve well i think and the price was just right from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mihir S

customer_reviews.title: Finally a long enough kickstand for my Trek
customer_reviews.text: My expensive Trek bike did not come with a kickstand, so annoying. I kept buying ones at the store and they were all too short! Thankful this is one that comes long and you cut down to the size you need, worked perfect, super easy to cut down to the correct size and cheap! I'm happy, it works, no more leaning my bike up against stuff in the garage, yay!
customer_reviews.author: LOVETHEBEACH21

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: so I bought these to replace the ones installed by the bike shop. Very easy to install on my kids bikes both are a 26 inch mountain bikes. but very hard on my 29er. the problem was to spot that it had to go required me to bust my knuckles about thirty times before it got tight enough. No problem an old mechanic can do anything to make the piece go on and fit just right.
customer_reviews.author: danithib

customer_reviews.title: Kickstand
customer_reviews.text: April 28, 2020: Not too difficult to measure and cut, just make sure to cut it flat (instead of angled like the line markers). Lesson learned, though the kickstand lost a little bit more than I was looking for. Easily bolted to the kids' bike and does what I need it to do. Would buy again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Big Trev

customer_reviews.title: Perfect length for 26 inch townie 8i
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfect, although I should have ordered the one designed for a bike WITH the kickstand plate built in. My fault for not double checking. The bolt is longer in this version so that it can be used on bikes without a built in kickstand plate. Arrived ahead of schedule and works much better than the one that was on the bike!
customer_reviews.author: macwo1f

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kickstand to replace a poor quality adjustable stand that came on my mountain bike. This kickstand is very good quality. It was easy to install and fit my 26" mountain bike perfectly. I had another bike years ago that had a Greenfield Kickstand on it and it was very good. I've glad to see Greenfield still makes a quality kickstand.
customer_reviews.author: DWB

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to my mountain bikes.
customer_reviews.text: I added two of these kickstands to our two old Trek 830 and 850 mountain bikes that came without kickstands. These are easy to install and are solid as a rock when bolted in place. I had to custom cut for length but that took less than 5 minutes to accomplish with a hacksaw. Now I can stand them up instead of laying them down. A great product.
customer_reviews.author: Oldfartsoftballplayer

customer_reviews.title: works perfect
customer_reviews.text: got this for my son's 27.5 XS frame cannondale mountain bike and it went right on, didn't interfere with any cables and is rock solid and the perfect height. i expected to have to modify it at least a little but it was perfect. very light and doens't seem to flop around when riding.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Way too big and no rubber foot!
customer_reviews.text: This was way too big for a 26" mountain bike. Luckily my husband had the tools to cut it down to size. Also, it does not come with a rubber foot as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Wrublewski

customer_reviews.title: Important Length...!!  285 too short for most mountain bikes...
customer_reviews.text: Measure the bottom of the bike to the ground... Our bike is a schwinn MOAB3 high, and this 285 length may be too short.. Bike man said anything over 10 3/4 then order the 305 length kickstand.... We are waiting for the boot to be installed.. the boot arrived and the boot or shoe is awesome .. BUT THIS KICKSTAND IS TOO SHORT FOR OUR MOUNTAIN BIKE.. WE ARE RETURNING FOR THE 305 LENGTH
customer_reviews.author: Technicean

customer_reviews.title: Fits a BMX
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a BMX (Eastern Lowdown) bike there is a spot right behind the pedals in the frame that is cut out and this thing fit right into the hole and mounted up. It’s light sleek and sturdy so it does not take anything away from the BMX experience. Had a couple day delay in shipping but it’s COVID so yeah not faulting Kyles Bikes for it. Great Buy
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great kickstand that fit perfectly on my Trek mountain bike. It is so much better than the kickstands you pick up in the big box stores. You can easily fit it to your own bike and the core aluminium makes it much more sturdy then the hollow and adjustable ones. Very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Talon Driver

customer_reviews.title: great kickstand but.......
customer_reviews.text: Love the kickstand but was disappointed that the kickstand did not come with the shorter hex bolt for bikes with the built in kickstand bracket. A trip to hardware store and I got a short bolt to fit in. The longer bolt that came with kickstand concerned me it stuck out too far. Overall quality of kickstand is good. I should have read all the 55 answered questions on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA (and a good product/price too)!
customer_reviews.text: We've had this brand on out bikes for over 5 years now, and that kickstand is still doing great. Solid metal construction and a spring that keeps it in place. Only downside is that it isn't adjustable, but I truthfully don't see why you need that level of precision on a kickstand. If it's too high, you can always cut some off the tip. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Spangler

customer_reviews.title: Great price, but did not realize you needed a hacksaw to cut to length
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my kids' bikes (16" and 20" wheels). The kickstand was way too long for them. Turns out you have to cut it to length (it comes with instructions), which you do with a hacksaw and metal file. Kind of a pain and unexpected, but at the end of the day, it works and was inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn F

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, Buy This One!
customer_reviews.text: This kickstand is wonderful! High quality, much nicer than what normally comes on a kid's bike. It did take several cuts to get the right length, but the bike is very stable. The little boot is nice, but I accidentally bought an extra one b/c Amazon suggested it so I thought it didn't come in the kit. It does, so don't buy an extra.
customer_reviews.author: Prisca

customer_reviews.title: A really good inexpensive stand
customer_reviews.text: I just got a bike in the middle of the pandemic and lo & behold the bike store was sold out of stands. I looked up what existing stands were in use before and I just ordered the same one and installed this on my Trek bike. Installs in a few minutes and is stable.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built, fits 26" bike perfectly
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing realized that the same brand was on other family member bikes too. Seems like a popular item. Black is matte finish and perfectly matched the dark matte finish of the bike. Good thing I got the black one for a couple of dollars more than the unpainted aluminum one. Works very smooth and holds the bike sturdy. Did not need to cut the length for a 26" bike.
customer_reviews.author: Mrtz

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This model needs to be cut to fit a smaller bicycle, which then leaves a sharp end on the kickstand - yet the company does not send a protective rubber foot. Guess it's my fault for not analyzing more closely what I was buying, but I can't believe a company would want this to go on the bicycle of a young child who may cut themselves on the end. Think twice before buying this product because I definitely would not have bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Kalkwarf

customer_reviews.title: Not too happy
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice kickstand. It is made in USA, that is why I got it. Only problem is, that it is wobbly when it is up, and wobbly when it stands (Non Retail). I ordered another, This is the Retail, and came in the box. It is not wobbly, and it is stiff, and stands good. Maybe the non retail in a bag was defective. I am sending that back, and keeping the retail kickstand.
customer_reviews.author: King Dimitrios

customer_reviews.title: KS2-305B 305mm Kickstand on a 700c Genesis Roadtech
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Greenfield KS2-305B 305mm Kickstand for my 700c Genesis Roadtech road bike. It was a little long so I had to cut a little of it off but that gave me the ability to adjust the length so the bike stood a straighter when the kickstand was down. The bike used to lean a little too much with the old kickstand. I have the Topeak Explorer Bike Rack and trunk mounted on this bike and when I had a few things in the trunk the bike would tip over because the old kickstand was to short. The foot or boot did not come with this, I just used my old one off the old kickstand.
customer_reviews.author: Bluedues

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these for various sizes of bikes. Sturdier than other store brands and we have a couple that are still going strong a few years later. I really like the marks that run up the side of the stand to make it easier to gauge where to cut when a shorter stand is required. Great bike stand.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: Great kickstand, for 20" and smaller bikes....
customer_reviews.text: Installed one of these kickstands on my 2 sons bikes, my 9 yr old has a new 20" Mongoose bmx bike, and while my 5 yr old has a 14" TMNT bike. The ksb2 fit my 9 yr olds bike perfectly, no sawing needed. While my 5 yr olds bike needed the kickstand to be hacksawed about 4 inches shorter. It was quick work to shorten the length, and works great on both the 20 & 14" bikes perfectly... Thos kickstand seems to be made very robust & hope it withstands both boys heavy use...
customer_reviews.author: Tech Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent aluminum kick-stand.
customer_reviews.text: Great kickstand, relatively light, truly all-aluminum construction that has no corrosion as well as lighter weight. It also comes with the added top-piece to sandwich and mount on bikes that don't have a kick-stand threaded mount (it will work with the threaded mounts as well). Just keep in mind that you'll probably have to trim the length of this kick-stand using a saw or grinder that can cut through aluminum. If you have a very large bike/frame, it's possible you can use this without trimming, but in my experience, most bikes will require that you trim the stand down once you've mounted it.
customer_reviews.author: SunInSouthFlorida

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: This kickstand is very good quality and I’m glad that it is made in the USA. I had to find a YouTube video that showed the best way to measure and trim the kickstand once it is installed. I chose to grind off the extra length instead of using a hacksaw. Ended up being faster and more effective.
customer_reviews.author: E-Biz024

customer_reviews.title: Good Black Kickstand, No Rubber Foot
customer_reviews.text: I bought the black kickstand and it was pretty easy to install. I have a Trek FX1 bike with 28” wheels and it worked perfectly. Overall, it’s lightweight, and sturdy. I took off a star because the black paint is sprayed on and there are a couple small areas where you see the silver material. Also it does not come with the rubber foot, it’s sold separately.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Quality kickstand
customer_reviews.text: I like how light this kick stands is compared to the Bell. Cutting it too size was a bit of a chore but I was able to get as perfect length for my kids 16 inch bike. I used a snap hacksaw. If you have a Dremel it'll be a snap. It's also easy for him to kick up and down.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Arteaga

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Had to cut it down with metal saw to fit child’s bike. Very sturdy... sometimes difficult for my child to put it down bc it is quite strong. I wish it was cheaper for what it is. But I bought it during the COVID pandemic, so choices were limited.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to add a kickstand to my 2019 Trek FX 2 (size Large) and this does the trick well. I purchased the 285mm version and cut about 5cm off the end. I'll use it for a while and may cut another 5cm off later. We'll see. It bolted on very easily on my bike and fit well.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Adjustments needed, but easy to do
customer_reviews.text: Bought for 16" Trek kid's bike. Package did not come with a rubber foot. (That's been very confusing from comments). Easy to cut adjustment with a hacksaw. There are markings along kickstand to help with adjustment and angle to cut. Cut and installed. Easy enough.
customer_reviews.author: zenny

customer_reviews.title: Great kickstand for little kids since it is smooth doesn't need much effort to use.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works perfect. My son complained about the other one I bought because it was too hard for him to activate and kick up. This one works with ease and has a nice spring action to it to hold it in place. You do have to cut it to size, but it took me 5 minutes. It even comes with a rubber foot to give it a finished look.
customer_reviews.author: Toph

customer_reviews.title: Solid kick stand.
customer_reviews.text: The base snapped on me when I was tightening down the bolt. Luckily, I had an extra. I have gotten two of these now and I like how solid they are. I buy the little rubber foot to go along with these. Just don't over tighten the bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Must trim to fit?? Too heavy for a kid anyway
customer_reviews.text: Way too heavy duty for a child’s bike! Heavy duty is nice in theory but this is insane! Also, you have to trim it to fit! With what tools?? No where did I see this mentioned- perhaps I didn’t read carefully. Sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Mamabear

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my kid's 16 bike, but it was way too long. I had to cut it about 3 times to make it fit. Yes, it cuts fairly easily with a hacksaw, but you have to cut it at an angle for it to stand properly. I had to make a lot of adjustments and file it down. In the end it works, so it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Corin

customer_reviews.title: Quality, adjustable to any length easily
customer_reviews.text: Added this to my daughter's 16" wheel bike. Why one didn't come on the bike is a mystery. Anyway, easy to install and adjust with a hacksaw. Comes with a rubber pad that fits over the end for safety, cusion, comfort, etc. Costs a little more than the others that I looked at, but I feel I made the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Looks quality made. Just doesn't fit my bike. I can't believe mountain bikes now have no stock mount for a kickstand and with disc brakes and options are limited to nill. Good quality mount would be easy to cut.
customer_reviews.author: Chrystal97

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but the screw is just pulling the plates together on my frame so I imagine after time it will come loose. I might look into a washer or something that could help that. No rubber foot. My bike stays up so that's good!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Real happy with the fit on my 26" Huffy
customer_reviews.text: This kickstand is a great price and it's easy to install. I had to bend mine a little bit because I have fat tires being 3.00 inches wide. It fits my 26in mountain bike perfect. No rubber tip was included.
customer_reviews.author: Power Von' Strokin

customer_reviews.title: Feels robust and stays in place both up and down
customer_reviews.text: Simple 1 bolt install. Used a hacksaw to cut off about 3/4" to make the bike it was on lean a little for stability. Not wobbly at all in either position. Perhaps the very best aftermarket kick stand around, just buy it
customer_reviews.author: Eagle,Wi

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Easy and perfect fit for an old Raleigh 15 speed I picked up at a resale. Didn't have to cut it any but it has marks if you do. I got the small rubber footpad. Helps to hold the bike on uneven ground or dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis P.

customer_reviews.title: A great product at a great price and made in America ...
customer_reviews.text: A great product at a great price and made in America too! It's very solid when up and down. It needed to be cut down a little to fit correctly for me. The design is perfect and I can't imagine anything better to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement on a Woman's Schwinn Mountain Bike
customer_reviews.text: The original kickstand on my wife's bike never really kept the bike upright. I don't know what the problem was, since both her and I had the same style of bike, mine sat correctly on the kickstand, her's leaned over so far it always fell over. Seeing as how the bikes were kept near my car, this was a big issue! This replacement was slightly taller than the kickstand that came with the bike, but what a difference it made. The bike now stands as it should and is no longer in a constant state of nearly falling over. 4 stars mean "I like it" on the Amazon scale. It was worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Breadtruck

customer_reviews.title: The same as stock.. don't waste the $$
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and the rubber foot, hoping it was a larger kickstand for a top-heavy bike... It's nothing better than what came as stock on the bike.. If you don't have a kickstand, this is a nice one to have but if your looking for an upgrade.. look elsewhere...
customer_reviews.author: BuyToReview

customer_reviews.title: Very good and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to work with and very sturdy too. You can cut and sand within 5 mins without a power tool and make perfect fit to any bike. It's under 12 dollars and I don't think I can ask more.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: I was buying it for a 20 inch bike. It needs to be cut and sanded before it can be installed. The description on the listing omits this, but I guess to a lot of users this is obvious, based on the reviews. Even on the packaging it says it needs professional installation. It would have been good to know this before buying. I have not tested installation and other properties.
customer_reviews.author: Jyoti Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Great Kickstand -- Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 28" bike. Very easy to install and the design allows you to adjust the angle of the stand as well. Took me about 5 minutes to install (it would have been 3 minutes, but it took me about 1 minute to cut the leg down by about an inch or so). Seems very sturdy. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: David Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Much assembly required
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't really clear I'd have to cut it down to size. Luckily I had a dremel. Would've taken forever with a hand saw. Also, this did NOT come with the rubber tip that were even mentioned in the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: W. Ardis

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: perfect for my bike with 26" wheels (i bought the larger size). it could maybe use a quarter inch shaved off since the bike is a little wobbly on un-even ground, but works great. also love how it comes in black, looks sleek with a black bike
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Well-made and easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: I picked up a new bike for my son just recently and of course, it didn't come with a kickstand. Why manufacturers don't include one is beyond me, but nevertheless, I opted for this unit since I' familiar with it, having one on my own bike. Sure enough, the 285mm was a perfect fit - and since it didn't require a mounting hole (which this GT mountain bike didn't have), it installed easily. The unit itself seems very well made, lightweight and yet sturdy, with a very nice action to it. Really can't think of much more to say other than that this is a really nice unit and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A.

customer_reviews.title: Great old style kickstand for bike
customer_reviews.text: Put this on my Schwinn Voyager. I wanted a sturdy old style kickstand and this was perfect. Been using it for months now and its just fine. Would highly recommend this. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G. Rawlins

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, just as described
customer_reviews.text: Item just as described. It was too long for my kid's bike, but per the instructions I used a hacksaw and took off what I needed to make it work, and filed the ends so it wasn't sharp. I would recommend buying the separate rubber foot that goes on it. I do wish that came with it. Otherwise, it works well and was easy to put on and trim to fit.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Working great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install on a 26" cruiser bike. It was almost too long, so I cut about 1" off the end and now seems to be the perfect height. It's lighter weight than the original kickstand but no worries about strength.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfect. Sleek and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried it wouldn’t fit my 29er karate monkey but it is perfect. I have big feet, but the kickstand is well out of the way. The spring seems like it’ll keep it from popping down when I go off curbs, but we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needed Cutting but Worth the Effort
customer_reviews.text: This did take some cutting as it was too long on a Trek 20" (large) frame. I took about 1 3/4" off (which is a lot) and then put the rubber foot on the end. I cut the end off with a fine tooth hack saw. It only took a minute since it's aluminum. I did not use the top plate, as it was unnecessary. The Allen screw goes right into the kickstand plate of my bike. The detent is perfect from kickstand up to down. It looks and feels like quality.
customer_reviews.author: Robert JonesTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Goto kick stand it's the best!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product. I have seen it in use on other bikes, and used one myself for many years. When I installed it, the bolt engagement in the aluminum threads seemed slightly weak. Therefore I recommend using a small amount of threadlocker on it to help keep things sweet.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Americoid

customer_reviews.title: Great Kickstand!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my 19" frame mountain bike. There are measurement lines on the inside of the stand so if it's too long you can take a hacksaw to it. Great spring strength. I also like the fact that there is no nut, just a bolt. Makes install easier.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. E Buyer

customer_reviews.title: 305mm length fits 29 inch MTB with no cutting
customer_reviews.text: This 305mm length is perfect for a 29er that I use to bash around town.. It’s the only bike I own that actually has a kickstand... fantastic spring action — highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Stark

customer_reviews.title: Choose this one!
customer_reviews.text: Put on a 20 inch boys bike. Used a dremel to cut off about an inch. It did come with a boot to cover the cut. Unpacked, cut, and installed in about 15 minutes. Most of that was determining where to cut. Great solution. Easier for my 8 yr old to operate than the one originally on the bike!
customer_reviews.author: Female Consumer

customer_reviews.title: works great and easy install
customer_reviews.text: looks and works great, I bought the 305 instead of the 285 and cut about an inch of for my 47cm frame on 700c. so the 285mm would have been fine but I didn't want to risk coming up short. install was easy, I used a cut off wheel but I'm sure you could use a hacksaw if needed, the alloy is soft enough that maybe a few minutes by hand should do it. I'm thinking of polishing it to match the velo hammered fenders i'm looking at
customer_reviews.author: bunny

customer_reviews.title: Fits fine and springs up and down smartly
customer_reviews.text: This kickstand fits a 1997 Raleigh M20 mountain bike with 26" tires. The stand comes with two bolts, one for mounting with the pictured top plate and a shorter one for bicycles that already have a welded kickstand plate in their frame. It also comes with a rubber foot for use in soft or loose terrain. At it's factory length the bicycle leans ever so slightly to the side. I'm not sure it's necessary to trim it. However, doing so it easy enough thanks to the marks on the stand for where to cut with a hacksaw.
customer_reviews.author: AverageJoe

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: went on perfect after I put a piece of electrical tape on each part that touched my frame. I like having a kickstand since I don't have to find something to lean it on every time I get off. I ride my mountain bike on the road mostly, this kickstand is simple and awesome.
customer_reviews.author: MPD

customer_reviews.title: OEM Version sold, beware older reviews that speak of rubber feet
customer_reviews.text: I was quite disappointed to learn that the model being sold right now is the OEM version which comes with only the bare minimum and does NOT include the other accessories such as rubber foot and alternate mounting bolt, which is what older reviews claim to include in this item. I'm not sure where the oversight is here, but beware when buying. The fact that this was also too long felt like salt in the wound, though not really anyone's fault in this case. Hoping to eventually mount this on my Specialized Sirrus Sport, size M.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick O.

customer_reviews.title: hard to install
customer_reviews.text: it bolts from the top down and with the angle of the frame and the front derailer right there very hard to get a wrench on the bolt would be much better if bolt came from the bottom
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Working good
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned when I saw this kickstand in person, that it was not going to work well. It has not been in service long, but so far is working very well. I mounted it on a 26" mountain bike and the size was perfect. Now my son's bike is not always laying on the ground getting beat up and stands nicely. The kickstand also sets securely so as not to come down while cycling. I have used stands in the past that I prefer to this style, but have been unable to find them recently. This one will do for now, but there are better ones out there.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mefford

customer_reviews.title: The bike was designed for a kickstand just like this. On mine the bike's chainstays aren't designed ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. One each for mine and my wife's commuter bikes. On my wife's bike, it fit perfectly. The bike was designed for a kickstand just like this. On mine the bike's chainstays aren't designed for a kickstand, but it still works well. I tightened the bolt pretty tight and the kickstand can still move if I push hard on it, but I didn't want to risk crushing the bike tubes. I suspect this kickstand could do that if I over-tightened it.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Basic kickstand that is simple enough to cut down
customer_reviews.text: Installed on my kids little 16" bike - cut with a angle grinder and used a metal file to round the edges so they're not sharp. Works well, and not too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: CLTGUY

customer_reviews.title: Ehhhh
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this stand for my sons bike and it was unusable! We could not install it to be functional! Poor design. It was however very durable. Just can’t use it.
customer_reviews.author: Joni Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Kickstand actually gets used and it works
customer_reviews.text: When we got my son his BMX bike it didn't come with a kickstand. I thought I could take the kickstand from his smaller bike and use it on his new 20 inch BMX. The kickstand was a Schwinn adjustable length kickstand. Even at the longest setting the bike would not stand sturdy. Most of the time it fell it over so my son quit using it. I purchased this kickstand with the positive reviews and good price knowing I had to get something that worked better. It was easy to install, works perfectly, and I haven't had to re-tighten it once. It stays in place great, even with a young boy probably not being the nicest to his kickstand.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be shortened for child’s bike.
customer_reviews.text: Seems really nice. Bought it for our four year olds bike but it needs to be cut to fit his small bike. We haven’t cut it yet but once we do it should be great.
customer_reviews.author: Nikoliko

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comes with rubber foot.
customer_reviews.text: Great stand that actually came with the rubber footing. I didn’t know that it was included but it is. You can cut the stand down to whatever size you need but the best part is since it’s in the middle in the under side of the frame no scratches to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: dru1313

customer_reviews.title: Double check sizing
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously easy to install. May have ordered the wrong size despite the recommended size based on my bike size. It’s also wiggly. Nevertheless, it was easy, inexpensive and worth the $10
customer_reviews.author: ABClark

customer_reviews.title: Tops
customer_reviews.text: These kickstands really are the best. I have used them for years. Easy to install, stable and sturdy. You can also cut the end to fit your bike to stand at a different angle. Years of flawless service.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Classic - Lightweight - Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: I've used these on quite a few vintage bikes. They are simple, strong, lightweight and appear appropriate on older bikes. Unbeatable for the low price.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan B.

customer_reviews.title: No longer comes with rubber foot
customer_reviews.text: The first time I ordered one of these, it came just as pictured, rubber foot and all. This time, not so much. I realize the rubber foot is not mentioned in the description anymore, but the picture and previous order deceived me. There may be a better price out there for just a kickstand. I got it again because the rubber foot addition made it a good deal. Other than that, it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality product but it is NOT going to fit ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality product but it is NOT going to fit every bike. Needs a lot of room in the space next to the bottom bracket between the chainstay bridge or a dedicated kickstand mount to make this work. I have 2 Treks, 1 is old school and the other fairly modern, no dice. Good quality though, made in USA so they get 4 stars just know it may not work for you.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Great kickstand for the price
customer_reviews.text: The material was good quality, but I had to shorten it (instructions were great). After shortening, the kickstand worked perfectly. The grandson loves it
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect length.
customer_reviews.text: This 305mm kickstand fits my 21" Motobecane Elite Adventure bike perfectly w/o cutting or adjustments. Didn't come with a rubber foot so I ordered the Greenfield foot separately. Fits perfect too!. The stand by itself leaned the bike about 25 30 degrees. With the rubber foot on it straightened up to 10-15 degrees. Opens and closes easily. I found a right sized lock washer so I placed that on. Doesn't come with a lock-washer or a nut but they aren't really needed. Doesn't interfere with any cables, derailleurs, brakes, gears or spokes. Really nice fit. Wrench it on tight (size 14 wrench) and forget it.
customer_reviews.author: R. SAFRENOTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great kickstand. Easy to mount, tough, pretty lightweight. There's nothing more I can ask for. The cut lines are handy even though I personally didn't need them. Also, I suggest greasing the bolt before assembling it just so the steel and aluminum don't corrode together. As an example, my '58 Raleigh Sports came from the factory with an aluminum kickstand and I have tried everything short of drilling it out and that shyte is never coming off, haha.
customer_reviews.author: hotdog428

product_meta.title: Greenfield Kickstand
product_meta.description: The world standard for quality. Aluminum alloy. Two sizes and colors to choose from. Made in the U.S.A. Bottom Bracket Mount. 285 mm, fits most size frames. 305 mm, 22" frames or higher.
feature_bullets: For bikes without factory mounting plate (includes top plate and bolt)

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
